channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Thought Markets Were Volatile in the First Half? Watch Out.
item.description: Stocks have rebounded, but the dollar is in a deep slump. Here’s what could go right (and very wrong) for investors.

item.title: Sean Combs trial update: The jury is deliberating over a complex set of charges
item.description: The hip-hop mogul faces an overlapping set of charges that include sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy. The jury resumes deliberations on Tues...

item.title: Ford Foundation’s New Leader Is From Yale Law School
item.description: Heather K. Gerken, the dean of the law school, will run the powerful philanthropy, known for pushing for social justice.

item.title: As light pollution increases, West Texas works to protect the world's largest 'dark sky reserve'
item.description: While recent research shows the night sky is getting brighter every year across North America, the Big Bend area in Texas has fended off the light glo...

item.title: Remembering veteran PBS newscaster Bill Moyers
item.description: Moyers, who died June 26, worked as a special assistant to President Lyndon Johnson before becoming an award-winning journalist and PBS host. Original...

item.title: Differences Over Policy Bill Reignite the Trump-Musk Feud
item.description: President Trump ratcheted up his rhetoric against Elon Musk, at one point suggesting that he could be interested in attempting to deport him.

item.title: Most Americans feel democracy is theatened, poll shows. And, Mamdani speaks with NPR
item.description: A new poll shows that 76% of Americans believe democracy is facing a serious threat. And, Zohran Mamdani sits down with NPR to discuss his run for NYC...

item.title: The U.S. Sends Lots of Plastic Trash Overseas. Malaysia Just Said No Thanks.
item.description: No country receives more discarded plastic from wealthy countries, but shipments from the United States are no longer welcome.

item.title: What’s in the Trump Policy Bill?
item.description: We take a closer look at some less discussed provisions.

item.title: Trump plans to visit Florida's new migrant detention center, 'Alligator Alcatraz'
item.description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis said that the facility should be "ready for business" by the time Trump visits on Tuesday — despite the protests of pro-immi...

item.title: 3 Managers Arrested Over Deaths at U.K. Hospital Where Lucy Letby Worked
item.description: People who were managers when Ms. Letby was convicted of killing babies were arrested on suspicion of manslaughter by gross negligence.

item.title: Top Russian General Convicted in High-Profile Corruption Case
item.description: Timur Ivanov, a longtime deputy defense minister, was sentenced to 13 years in a penal colony, according to the Russian state news agency Tass.

item.title: Israel’s Netanyahu Says He Will Meet With Trump Next Week
item.description: The Israeli prime minister’s expected visit to the United States comes as the cease-fire with Iran may create new momentum for a truce in Gaza.

item.title: Britain’s Royal Train, Once a Symbol of Luxury and Modernity, Is Being Retired
item.description: Specially commissioned private rail cars have transported the royal family around the country for over 150 years, beginning with an initially trepidat...

item.title: The U.S. Sends Lots of Plastic Trash Overseas. Malaysia Just Said No Thanks.
item.description: No country receives more discarded plastic from wealthy countries, but shipments from the United States are no longer welcome.
